Text.Value: Leave.
Think you disappointed this lot, swooping in to save us like that. Careful - might turn on you just as quick.

EditorData.NodeContext: Spiteful, re tiefling refugees who had sealed them outside. Petty and mean-spirited.
EditorData.logicalname: Has not met / Done cleaning wound.

Text.Value: Once we're patched up, we're gone.
Damn sight better than what Zevlor's got coming, after leaving us to die like that.
A good death. He earned his place in Warrior's Rest.
Might be more blood spilled yet, if Zevlor starts in on the lectures again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Making a threat - all big talk with no real bite behind it.

Text.Value: Weren't no profit in saving Liam - you'd make a crap sellsword. But... thanks.

EditorData.NodeContext: Considering you, half pitying of your naive heroism, half pleasantly surprised by it.

Text.Value: You should get that arm seen to.
As close as you're gonna get from me today, friend.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, REMIRA finishes up and puts her cloth away as she speaks, ANIM: _CleansWound_OUT
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

Text.Value: Damned... goblins...

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, REMIRA is cleaning a wound on her LEFT ARM as we approach. ANIM: _CleansWound_LOOP
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Remira is dabbing at a cut on her arm and hissing in pain as we approach.
EditorData.NodeContext: Hissing in pain as she dabs at a wound on her arm.

Text.Value: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

Text.Value: Even the new lad - his first contract, and we land him in a godsdamned goblin nest.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shaking her head at how the job went badly

Text.Value: Was that a 'thank you'?
Ogle the gash in her flesh.
That was lesson one, if Liam had only bloody listened.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tone is very much 'I tried to train him properly but I can only do so much'

Text.Value: Oh, very gracious of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

Text.Value: You're all right, for a tiefling. At least you fight.
We're packing up and I'd advise you do the same. Seems our kind ain't welcome here.
I already regret saving your life.
He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.
Wait for her to finish cleaning the wound.
And what about our people? Half the crew's lying dead back in that ruin.

EditorData.NodeContext: Feeling hard done by - you're pointing out the harm she did and she's acting like she's the one harmed.

Text.Value: *You lose yourself in the scab's weeping sea. It is no masterwork, but it provides a base bliss to gaze upon.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: dark urge getting a little bit excited and swoony

Text.Value: Nah. He... must've thought we were following. Always the optimist, was Liam.

EditorData.NodeContext: Rare moment of honesty and reflection. Still trying to act tough, but thinking about the fact that Liam may have actually looked up to her and she's let him down.

Text.Value: Well. Finally - someone with some sense between their horns.
Well. Finally - someone who ain't got horns where their good sense should be.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's usually defensive but you've just signalled you might be on her side. The line is vaguely racist towards tieflings - even the version addressed to tieflings themselves.

Text.Value: We're heading out. Good luck with your 'kin'.
We're packing up and I'd advise you do the same. Seems our kind ain't welcome here.
Oh aye? I was just going to let it fall off, stick it in my satchel.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, REMIRA finishes up and puts her cloth away as she speaks, ANIM: _CleansWound_OUT [DUPE]
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.
EditorData.NodeContext: Tone is 'oh I hadn't thought of that, you're so smart' - but mocking and sarcastic

Text.Value: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, REMIRA is cleaning a wound on her LEFT ARM as we approach. ANIM: _CleansWound_LOOP [DUPE]
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

Text.Value: Just another raw recruit thought he was in some storybook.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive, disgusted - it's his own fault he's dead. Or that's what she's trying to tell herself.

Text.Value: But aye, maybe you could... say a prayer, or something? Just... put in a good word, like.

EditorData.NodeContext: Moment of reflection - she's more superstitious than religious, but you're a priest suggesting that her friend might have earned a place of prestige in the afterlife and she almost wants to believe it.

Text.Value: He died with bravery. You should be proud.
Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, REMIRA finishes up and puts her cloth away as she speaks, ANIM: _CleansWound_OUT [DUPE]
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

Text.Value: I'd have done the same in your place.
I'm guessing that didn't end well.
Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

Text.Value: Hope they cut him down quick before he saw we were gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quietly - she's ashamed but still trying to brush it off.

Text.Value: Ain't letting anyone here near me. They all sat and watched while Zevlor near got us killed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resentful - she's feeling extremely hard done by because the tieflings blame her and her party for an attack that just occured.

Text.Value: These weren't no normal goblins. And Liam weren't no friend, all right?

EditorData.NodeContext: Immediately defensive - you're questioning her courage and suggesting she has feelings, two cardinal sins

Text.Value: Bravery? No. When it gets you killed, it's just called stupidity.

EditorData.NodeContext: Scornful, but hiding real hurt. He died because she ran and she's in denial.

Text.Value: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.
You should probably get that looked at.
Leave.
Like the sight of blood, do you? Thought you'd've had your fill at the gate.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, REMIRA finishes up and puts her cloth away as she speaks, ANIM: _CleansWound_OUT [DUPE]
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.
EditorData.NodeContext: She's caught you standing there waiting - tone is challenging.

Text.Value: Warrior, my arse - not even Tempus himself could teach Liam to swing straight.

EditorData.NodeContext: Snorting, derisive - you're making him out to be grander than he was.

Text.Value: So you just left your friend to the goblins?
My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

EditorData.logicalname: TO BE REMOVED PENDING SWEN REVIEW

Text.Value: You put your own people first. That's just the way it is.
You are to blame - you put his people in danger.
He actually stood and fought, the stupid bastard. Like I never trained him better.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

Synopsis:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
